decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of card advantage, counterspells, and removal, while utilizing graveyard recursion with Lurrus as a companion. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a mix of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and disruptive counterspells such as Spell Pierce and Force of Will. The deck also includes powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. With a diverse array of control elements and versatile threats like Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal while generating card advantage through cantrips and powerful draw spells. It also utilizes the graveyard as a resource with cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Soul-Guide Lantern. The deck aims to maintain control of the game by efficiently answering threats and out-valuing opponents with its powerful spells and versatile mana base.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to generate mana and card advantage, while also utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to bounce multiple artifacts back to hand to draw more cards. The goal is to assemble powerful combinations of artifacts, such as Coveted Jewel and Karn, the Great Creator, to generate a massive advantage over the opponent. The deck also includes various control elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful array of artifacts and combo off for a decisive victory.

The deck revolves around assembling the Phyrexian Dreadnought combo, which involves playing the Dreadnought alongside Doorkeeper Thrull to sacrifice it and trigger its ability. The deck includes multiple ways to protect the combo, such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, as well as ways to dig for the combo pieces like Stock Up and Lórien Revealed. The deck also includes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk for additional advantage. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion and value throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly, using cards like Mishra's Workshop and Mana Vault, and then use Paradoxical Outcome to draw a significant portion of the deck and play out powerful artifacts like Mystic Forge and The One Ring. This allows the player to set up a winning board state rapidly and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful artifacts and disruptive spells like Force of Will. The deck aims to create a dominant board state and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck is focused on aggressive strategies with a focus on disrupting the opponent's game plan. It aims to quickly ramp up mana using artifact accelerants like Moxen and Sol Ring, while also using cards like Sphere of Resistance and Thorn of Amethyst to slow down the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Nettlecyst to provide additional disruption, as well as using cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim for additional ramp and card advantage. The combination of artifacts and disruption makes it difficult for the opponent to keep up with the aggressive game plan.
